page.title: 17STARTFORTH CHURCH
page.content: Startforth Church was mentioned in the orignal Domesday book in which the following statment appeared, "At Stradford .......there is a church." No one knows when the church was first built but it was definately before 1086.The Revd. J.F. Hodgeson describes the old church as, "A small aisless building of Transitional origin." The present{church}was rebuilt in 1863.The font is the only remaining article from the old church.Inscribed on the font are the initials R.E.These stand for Robert Ellerton.There has been a church in Startforth for over 800 years.The congregation of the church is 30-40. There have been 42 vicars including the present one,Mr.C D'Aguire.
